title: Clear 'NO JOB ID PROVIDED' and 'EXPECTED V3 RESPONSE' error messages from UI

requirements.text: Remove or suppress the 'NO JOB ID PROVIDED' error message from the Results page UI. This message should not be displayed to the user under any circumstance — if no job ID is present, redirect silently or show a neutral fallback state instead.

quotes: clear the NO JOB ID PROVIDED and EXPECTED V3 response

acceptanceCriteria: The text 'NO JOB ID PROVIDED' does not appear anywhere in the rendered UI
When no job ID is present in the route/URL, the user is redirected or shown a neutral fallback (e.g., back to home) without displaying the raw error string

requirements.text: Remove or suppress the 'EXPECTED V3 RESPONSE' error message from the UI. This internal error string must not be shown to users — replace any occurrence with a neutral fallback message or silent error handling.

quotes: clear the NO JOB ID PROVIDED and EXPECTED V3 response

acceptanceCriteria: The text 'EXPECTED V3 RESPONSE' does not appear anywhere in the rendered UI
Any code path that previously surfaced this string either silently handles the condition or shows a user-friendly generic error message

constraints: Do not modify files under frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, or frontend/src/components/ui
nonGoals: Adding new error types or error tracking
